messages.message:
Day 2 for _*Daily Testing Tips + Tricks*_ :blob-dab: 
This is related to jest.
If you want to run the same set of tests with different preconditions/input, `describe.each()` allows us to write the test cases once and pass them in the data (doc (https://jestjs.io/docs/api#describeeachtablename-fn-timeout)).
One example in our code (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/e73e129fe9e2e4b07b2fa971ea38aa57ab1e4cdb/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/__tests__/pages/Settings/organization/index.test.tsx#L180): I used this trick to test CRUD operations on the org settings pages when logging in as a site admin and as an org admin. Here, I defined jest mocks in the array and called these in the `beforeEach` hook to mimic logging in as a site admin and as an org admin.

whoa iâ€™ve always used some weird combo of helper functions to do the same thing, but this is a lot cleaner!

thanks for sharing!! :heart:
